content: jack pine hat by sarah rody this hat uses the hexa grid cable motif from norah gaughan s knitted cable sourcebook there are both written instructions and a chart materials yarn about 180-210 yd 165-210 m of light worsted weight or heavy dk yarn i used malabrigo washted and tosh dk these are both about 210 yd/200 m per 100 g if your yarn is heavier you might run out of yarn if you are worried about running short of yarn you can opt for a single brim needles size us 6 4 mm needles or whatever size is needed to make gauge 16-inch 40 cm circulars and double-pointed needles or your preferred method of medium- and small- circumference knitting in the round size us 4 3 5 mm needles or 1-2 sizes smaller than your main needles 16-inch circulars 40 cm for knitting the brim ribbing gauge 20 stitches and 27 row in 4 in x 4 in 10 cm x 10 cm of stockinette using the larger needles sizing this hat fits my 22-inch 56 cm head due to the stretch of the honeycomb brioche stitch i think it would fit about 20-24 inches 51-61 cm to adjust the length you could change the length of the ribbing you could also omit rounds 28-35 my finished hat is about 11 inches 28 cm deep unfolded honeycomb brioche i used the yarn over method rather than knit 1 below i found this blog/video to be helpful the ⊖ symbol i use for k1sl is not a standard symbol or term as far as i know since the brioche has a different round gauge than the cables this hat will benefit from a light blocking pattern cast on 108 stitches using the smaller needles i did a tubular cast on but any other stretchy cast on should work then join in the round and begin to knit in 1x1 ribbing for 3 5 inches 9 cm approximately 25 rounds for a folded brim or 1 5 inches 3 8 cm for a non-folded brim 1x1 ribbing *k1 p1* repeat until the end of the round change to larger needles and begin the chart or written instructions you will repeat the chart 3 times around change to small-circumference needles double pointed needles magic loop etc when necessary after the last round cut the yarn leaving an 8-inch 20 cm tail and thread it through the remaining 9 stitches twice weave in ends 1 written instructions round 1 *k1 p1* repeat until the end of the round 108 st round 2 *k2 p4 k1 m1l k2 p4 k2 p2 p1 sl1yo x 8 p1 p2* repeat 111 st round 3 *k2 p4 c4b p4 k2 p2 k1 k1sl x 8 k1 p2* repeat round 4 *k2 p4 k4 p4 k2 p2 sl1yo brp x 8 sl1yo p2* repeat round 5 *k2 p2 c4b c4f p2 k2 p2 k1sl k1 x 8 k1sl p2* repeat round 6 *k2 p2 k8 p2 k2 p2
